Title: Marketing Analyst, Campaign Performance Reporting & Analysis
Description:
As a Marketing Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for managing campaign performance reporting, analytics, and ROI attribution to optimize spend, maximize marketing effectiveness, and achieve maximum return on investment. You will develop and implement robust reporting frameworks, analyze campaign data to provide insights and recommendations, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and present findings to senior management. Staying current with industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics will be crucial for continuously improving campaign performance and effectiveness.

We are seeking a Marketing Analyst who is a team player with deep practical experience in reporting and analyzing the performance of marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate will drive insights that inform effective execution strategies, strategically aligning products with consumers to maximize ROI. Candidates should have a solid marketing and analytical background, with a working knowledge of finance/accounting concepts, and exceptional program management skills.

What You'll Do

 Conduct a detailed analysis of marketing campaigns to measure performance and ROI, providing insights and recommendations for optimization.  Develop and implement robust reporting frameworks to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and campaign effectiveness metrics.  Analyze campaign data to provide insights and recommendations for optimizing marketing strategies and tactics.  Advise on campaign optimizations that maximize effectiveness, ROI, and inform future spend allocation.  Leverage analytical tools and techniques to extract actionable insights from campaign data.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of campaign objectives and performance metrics.  Present findings and recommendations to senior management to drive informed decision-making.  Stay current with industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics to continuously improve campaign performance and effectiveness. 

What's In It For You

At Cox, we reward your hard work with meaningful benefits.

First, we offer a highly competitive compensation package, 401(k) with a generous company match, comprehensive healthcare, life, and disability benefits, plus numerous other benefits, including adoption assistance, pet insurance, and discounts on travel and cars!

We value people more than technology. That means you'll work within a culture and with a team that values your leadership, your experience, your contributions, and you - yes, you - as a person. We believe recognition is important, and Cox strives to celebrate those who help make us successful every day. We also encourage diversity and support inclusion; we want you to do you and feel comfortable doing so.

We also offer boundless opportunities for growth; you can sharpen your skills, learn a new talent, join a mentoring program, even earn an advanced degree. You'll find the potential for lateral or upward career growth within the Cox family businesses, including the innovative startups in transportation mobility, clean tech and more.

Who You Are

 Minimum 

 Bachelor's degree in a related discipline (business commerce). The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as 4 years' experience in a related field  Strong analytical mindset and approach, with basic financial acumen  Strategic thinking, courageous innovation, innate curiosity with track record of an analytical approach and drives insights into marketing effectiveness that advises campaign performance.  A forward-looking, optimistic team player, unbound by what has been done, what is traditional, and what has worked in the past  Ability to manage diverse campaigns across key stakeholders, with strengths in honing in on ROI-driven best practices  Expertise in using the MS Office suite: Excel for data analysis, projections, charting/graphs; PowerPoint for executive-level presentations; Tableau for querying and visualizations 

Preferred

 Familiarity with Salesforce reporting in Marketing Cloud / Datorama (SFMCI)  Experience working on marketing campaigns or business operations projects and/or teams  Tableau a plus for reporting, querying data, visualizations, creating self-serve dashboards  Experience SQL querying language 

USD 63,800.00 - 95,800.00 per year

Compensation

Compensation includes a base salary of $63,800.00 - $95,800.00. The base salary may vary within the anticipated base pay range based on factors such as the ultimate location of the position and the selected candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities. Position may be eligible for additional compensation that may include an incentive program.

Benefits

The Company offers eligible employees the flexibility to take as much vacation with pay as they deem consistent with their duties, the company's needs, and its obligations; seven paid holidays throughout the calendar year; and up to 160 hours of paid wellness annually for their own wellness or that of family members. Employees are also eligible for additional paid time off in the form of bereavement leave, time off to vote, jury duty leave, volunteer time off, military leave, parental leave, and COVID-19 vaccination leave.

About Cox Communications

Cox Communications is the largest private telecom company in America, serving six million homes and businesses. That's a lot, but we also proudly serve our employees. Our benefits and our award-winning culture are just two of the things that make Cox a coveted place to work. If you're interested in bringing people closer through broadband, smart home tech and more, join Cox Communications today!

About Cox

Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses - which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications - is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today!

Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page .

Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.4 years of experience in project and process management in the technology industry or a related field.Experience working with analytical tools or data analysis (e.g., SQL, Business Intelligence/dashboards).

Preferred qualifications:

Experience in content policy, anti-abuse, or customer support operations and in data analysis/coding (e.g., Python).Knowledge of international and geopolitical events and how they may impact a global company.Ability to review sensitive or graphic content as it relates to escalation management.Ability to work through ambiguity, grow in a rapidly changing environment, and to function well in high-pressure situations.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work successfully in cross-functional teams (e.g., with stakeholders and executives).

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Search and Generative AI team within Trust and Safety keep users safe and improve the quality of Google's Search and Generative AI products. As part of this team, you will develop and manage cross-functional relationships with Operations, Engineering, Product and Legal teams in a multifaceted effort to improve our processes for identifying and resolving policy and quality issues on Search and Generative AI. You will be responsible to analyze market trends, set forward-looking strategy, and implement scaled solutions to solve user safety and quality issues, to ensure a high-quality user experience across Search and Generative AI products.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $108,000-$158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities

Perform on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage, and make consistent policy decisions and implement timely fixes, often under pressure.Ensure trust and reputation not only for Search and Generative AI, but also for Google as a broader brand and company, by fighting abuse and badness on a wide range of features.Analyze data on past escalations to drive process, product, and policy improvements, and manage policy escalations processes across Search, News, Assistant and Generative AI.Analyze market trends, set forward-looking strategy, and implement scaled solutions to solve user safety and quality issues, to ensure a high-quality user experience.Develop and manage cross-functional relationships with Engineering, Product, Legal and Operations teams in a multifaceted effort to improve our processes for identifying and resolving policy and quality issues on Search and Generative AI.

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description:
The Business Marketing Group (BMG) team connects businesses with their customers on Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger to help them grow their businesses through solutions like pages, advertising, messaging, commerce and more. We succeed when we help our customers grow their business leveraging our solutions.The Marketing Audiences and Measurement team sits within the Growth Marketing Operations team, helping realize the vision and strategy of marketers by designing and building audiences and measuring performance of marketing campaigns and initiatives. Besides marketing execution, the team partners closely with Growth Marketing to identify areas of opportunities for marketing.We are searching for a Marketing Analyst who will enable the execution of marketing campaigns to deliver lead generation, and self-service recommendations to advertisers. This includes responsibility for marketing campaign analytics execution (from target audience identification, opportunity sizing, audience creation, performance readouts and debugging), running experiments, and delivering actionable campaign insights.To succeed in this role, this analyst will need a data driven mind-set with strong communication skills to work across technical and non-technical audiences and prior experience in marketing analytics.

Marketing Analyst Responsibilities:

Design, analysis, and interpretation of projects from data requirement gathering to data processing, modeling, and recommendationsAudience identification, and opportunity sizing for all channel marketing campaignsBuild and maintain marketing signals and channel marketing triggers (logic which identifies when we send a particular email to a particular customer)Debug, triage, and identify the right team to resolve the issuesPerform campaign performance analysis and create readouts (such as marketing metric performance, and success of the campaign)Identify opportunities for improvement through automation, streamlining processes and reducing campaign issues leveraging technology

Minimum Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in an analytics role, business strategy, marketing, finance, engineering, or equivalentExperience leveraging data to deliver business value and present data-driven insights to business audiencesExperience analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable solutions using advanced SQL skillsCommunication and collaboration skills to engage with multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders and different teams to deliver solutions efficientlyData driven with degree in quantitative discipline like Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Operations Research or equivalentResult-oriented self-starter with ambiguity, experience initiating and driving projectsExperience building cross functional relationships across a variety of functions to launch projects that drive business value

Preferred Qualifications:

Title: Manager - Market Research & Intelligence
Description:
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, VirginiaManager - Market Research & Intelligence

Capital One, a Fortune 500 company and one of the nation’s top 10 banks, offers a broad spectrum of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. Our goal is to create one of the nation’s great banks, and we have the necessary ingredients: a strong balance sheet, resilient businesses, a massive customer franchise, strong analytical capabilities, and great people. We nurture a work environment where people with a variety of thoughts, ideas and backgrounds, guided by our shared values, come together to make Capital One a great company – and a great place to work.

External Affairs (EA) works with many external and internal stakeholders to envision and create a world of greater socioeconomic opportunity through advocating for an inclusive society, building thriving communities, and creating financial tools that enrich lives. Our teams include Communications, Community Impact and Investment, Community Finance, CRA Strategy and Program Management, the Government and Political Affairs Group, Regulatory Relations, and Strategy and Engagement. Through our teams, we have access to a diverse group of motivated changemakers similarly focused on the ingredients for a better future.

Position Summary:

The Strategy and Engagement team is looking for a Manager, Market Research & Intelligence, with a firm understanding of public and corporate affairs and the issues management space. This associate will apply primary and secondary research to solve challenging problems and contextualize a variety of critical business issues. In this role, the associate will develop and deliver landscape analyses, stakeholder mapping, and crisis and issues reporting leveraging a mix of analytics tools and research methodologies. A key to success will be communicating and presenting data-backed insights in a compelling manner to influence senior leaders and inform strategic initiatives, communications strategies, and business priorities.

Responsibilities

 Lead issues monitoring and reporting around key topics and event-based moments through social listening, media, and stakeholder analysis methodologies  Develop research agendas and measurement approaches in partnership with EA teams to inform business action  Oversee the full life-cycle of a research project, including managing analysts and partnering with research vendors  Leverage and integrate primary research and media monitoring to produce ad hoc and recurring reports for leadership  Distill complex data into simple KPIs, data visualizations, dashboards, or scorecards  Spot and propose opportunities to bring deeper intelligence to the team around key audiences, issues, or the competitive landscape  Maintain knowledge of industry trends related to market and media research methodologies  Leverage tools such as Brandwatch, Tableau, YouGov, MRI, and Mintel 

We recognize that many life paths can contribute to interest in this role. We value all experience, whether gained in a classroom or through other paths, and invite everyone who meets the qualificationsto apply for this role.

Basic Qualifications

 High School Diploma, GED or equivalent certification  At least 5 years of experience in an insights and analytics function, market research, or management consulting environment or any combination of the three  At least 5 years of public affairs and crisis/issues management experience  At least 3 years using media monitoring and social listening tools  At least 1 year of people leadership experience 

Preferred Qualifications

 At least 2 years of experience using boolean search and query building  At least 2 years of people leadership experience  At least 2 years of guiding others through quantitative and qualitative research methodologies  Robust understanding of the policy, regulatory and issues management space

 2-5 years + experience in Ancillary Employee Benefits related field. High School Graduate. College degree preferred, but not required.
